CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security;Violation of Article 8 - Right to respect for private and family life
JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;Ján Šikuta;Lech Garlicki;Mihai Poalelungi;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested on suspicion of homicide .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( Sąd Rejonowy ) remanded him in custody , relying on the reasonable suspicion that he had committed the offence in question . The court considered that the need to secure the proper conduct of the investigation justified holding him in custody . The court also stressed the severity of the anticipated sentence .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG ( PERSON ) extended his detention until DATE . On DATE the court ordered that the term should be extended until DATE . On DATE it ordered that the applicant be kept in custody until DATE . In all its detention decisions the court relied on a strong suspicion that the applicant had committed the offences in question . The court repeatedly stressed that his detention was justified by the need to obtain further evidence .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ) indicted the applicant on charges of homicide , committed with an accomplice .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG ( PERSON ) extended the applicant ’s detention . It relied on the reasonable suspicion that the applicant had committed the offence with which he had been charged . It also referred to the need to secure the proper conduct of the proceedings as a justification for holding him in custody . On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal . In his appeal he maintained that , given his poor health , detention was putting a severe strain on him . He particularly relied on the atheromatosis which affected his legs .

CARDINAL . On DATE his appeal was dismissed by ORG ( Sąd Apelacyjny ) . It found that there was a risk that the applicant might tamper with evidence , having regard to the fact that the co - accused suffered from a mental disability .
CARDINAL . DATE and DATE the court held CARDINAL hearings .

CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE the applicant lodged applications with the ORG to have his detention lifted or replaced by another preventive measure . He referred to his health problems . The court dismissed the applications . It relied on the likelihood of a severe prison sentence of imprisonment being imposed on the applicant and the need to secure the proper conduct of the proceedings . It further observed that the applicant had received adequate medical care in prison .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG convicted the applicant as charged and sentenced him to CARDINAL years’ imprisonment . The applicant and his co - defendant appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeal . The applicant lodged a cassation appeal with ORG ( Sąd Najwyższy ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the judgment and remitted the case to the ORG . ORG extended the applicant ’s detention until DATE . The court referred to the seriousness of the offence with which he had been charged and to the need to secure the proper conduct of the proceedings .
CARDINAL . In the meantime , on DATE , as a result of the atheromatosis , the applicant ’s right leg was amputated .
CARDINAL . The applicant ’s detention was extended by decisions of the Poznań Regional Court of DATE , DATE ( upheld by ORG on DATE ) and DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG gave judgment and sentenced him to CARDINAL years’ imprisonment . The applicant appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of Appeal quashed the judgment and remitted the case to ORG .
CARDINAL . In the course of the court proceedings the applicant ’s pre - trial detention was regularly extended . The courts repeated the grounds given in the previous decisions .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged an application with the ORG to have his detention lifted or replaced by another preventive measure . He referred to his health problems and the need for specialist medical treatment . On DATE at the request of the applicant , the court ordered a medical examination . The results of the medical examination did not reveal grounds for release . However , in the experts’ opinion the applicant ’s state of health had deteriorated since the examination on DATE . The experts concluded that it had been the result of the natural progress of the illnesses ( atheromatosis and diabetes ) . Finally , they noticed that the atheromatosis had led to a serious ischemia of his left leg .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG acquitted and released the applicant . ORG appealed . The appeal was dismissed by ORG on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG ( Prokurator Apelacyjny ) lodged a cassation appeal with ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the cassation appeal was dismissed .

CARDINAL . During the entire proceedings , the applicant lodged numerous requests for his case to be examined speedily . However , he failed to lodge a complaint under LAW on DATE on complaints about a breach of the right to a trial within a reasonable time ( PERSON o skardze na naruszenie prawa strony do rozpoznania sprawy w postępowaniu sądowym bez nieuzasadnionej zwłoki ) ( “ the CARDINAL Act ” ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed a request for compensation for manifestly unjustified detention on remand under LAW with the ORG . The proceedings are pending .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG received a letter from the applicant dated DATE . The letter was sent while the applicant was detained in FAC ( PERSON ) . The envelope bears the following stamps : “ Censored , PERSON , on CARDINAL , Criminal Department III ” ( ORG , ORG , dnia CARDINAL , PERSON ) and an illegible signature . It appears that the envelope had been cut open and subsequently resealed with adhesive tape .

CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law and practice concerning the imposition of detention on remand ( aresztowanie tymczasowe ) , the grounds for its prolongation , release from detention and rules governing other , so - called “ preventive measures ” ( środki zapobiegawcze ) are stated in the ORG ’s judgments in the cases of ORG v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE and PERSON v. GPE , no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § DATE , CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law and practice concerning remedies for the excessive length of judicial and enforcement proceedings , in particular the applicable provisions of LAW , are stated in the ORG ’s decisions in the cases of ORG v. GPE no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ( dec . ) , § § DATE , ECHR CARDINAL-V , and NORP v. GPE no . CARDINAL ( dec . ) , ORG CARDINAL-VIII and in its the judgment in the case of GPE v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , § § CARDINAL , ECHR CARDINAL-V.

CARDINAL . NORP The legal provisions concerning monitoring of GPE correspondence applicable at the material time and questions of practice are set out in paragraphs CARDINAL of the judgment delivered by ORG in GPE , no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . Chapter CARDINAL of LAW , entitled “ Compensation for unjustified conviction , detention on remand or arrest ” , stipulates that the ORG is liable for wrongful convictions or for unjustifiably depriving an individual of his liberty in the course of criminal proceedings against him .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL provides , in so far as relevant :

“ CARDINAL . An accused who , as a result of the reopening of the criminal proceedings against him or of lodging a cassation appeal , has been acquitted or resentenced under a more lenient substantive provision , shall be entitled to compensation from ORG for the pecuniary and non - pecuniary damage which he has suffered in consequence of having served the whole or a part of the sentence imposed on him .
CARDINAL . Entitlement to compensation for pecuniary and non - pecuniary damage shall also arise in the event of manifestly unjustified arrest or detention on remand . ”

CARDINAL . Proceedings relating to an application under LAW are subsequent to and independent of the original criminal proceedings in which the detention has been ordered . The claimant can retrospectively seek a ruling as to whether his detention has been justified . He can not , however , test the lawfulness of his continuing detention on remand or obtain release .

CARDINAL . The relevant statistical data , recent amendments to LAW designed to streamline criminal proceedings and references to relevant ORG materials can be found in the ORG ’s judgment in the case of ORG ( see ORG v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , § § DATE and CARDINAL , DATE ) .
